title: Alexandrov theorem
summary: In mathematical analysis, the Alexandrov theorem, named after Aleksandr Danilovich Aleksandrov, states that if U is an open subset of R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} and f : U â†’ R m {\displaystyle f\colon U\to \mathbb {R} ^{m}} is a convex function, then f {\displaystyle f} has a second derivative almost everywhere.
